timeline.message: add config support for grpc client
simple grpc client config unit tests
add support for grpc client configuration
add support for grpc client configuration
remove 1.0 from grpc client bundle name
remove 1.0 from grpc client bundle name

timeline.bodyText: Does "when they are constructed" refer to the time that the configuration properties are applied or the time that gRPC targets  match the specified URI?
timeline.author: dmuelle
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,49 @@
+###############################################################################
+# Copyright (c) 2020 IBM Corporation and others.
+# All rights reserved. This program and the accompanying materials
+# are made available under the terms of the Eclipse Public License v1.0
+# which accompanies this distribution, and is available at
+# http://www.eclipse.org/legal/epl-v10.html
+#
+# Contributors:
+#     IBM Corporation - initial API and implementation
+###############################################################################
+# -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
+#CMVCPATHNAME com.ibm.ws.grpc.client/resources/OSGI-INF/l10n/metatype.properties
+#ISMESSAGEFILE FALSE
+#NLS_ENCODING=UNICODE
+#NLS_MESSAGEFORMAT_NONE
+
+
+clientConfig=GRPC Client Properties
+clientConfig.desc=Configuration properties to be applied to gRPC targets that match the specified URI when they are constructed

replies.bodyText:
This isn't phrased well at all - I used com.ibm.ws.jaxrs.2.x.config/resources/OSGI-INF/l10n/metatype.properties as a guide.
I'd intended for "when they are constructed" to apply to "the time that gRPC targets match the specified URI".  Would removing it completely be more clear?
Configuration properties to be applied to gRPC targets that match the specified URI
replies.author: wtlucy

timeline.bodyText:
are quotes necessary?
Currently supported types are jwt or oauth
timeline.author: dmuelle
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,49 @@
+###############################################################################
+# Copyright (c) 2020 IBM Corporation and others.

+#NLS_MESSAGEFORMAT_NONE
+
+
+clientConfig=GRPC Client Properties
+clientConfig.desc=Configuration properties to be applied to gRPC targets that match the specified URI when they are constructed
+
+target=Remote target
+target.desc=The remote gRPC target URI, with wildcard support.
+
+headersToPropagate=HTTP header names to propagate
+headersToPropagate.desc=HTTP header names to propagate from an inbound request to an outbound call.
+
+clientInterceptors=GRPC client Interceptors
+clientInterceptors.desc=A list of fully qualified class names for gRPC client interceptor classes.
+
+authnToken=Authorization token
+authnToken.desc=The type of authorization token to propagate.  Currently this must be "jwt" or "oauth".

timeline.bodyText:
this is news to me but IBM terminology specifies keepalive, one word. Here's the guidance-
keepalive
adjective
Pertaining to the amount of time that elapses before a message is sent to verify a connection.
noun
A TCP/IP mechanism where a small packet is sent across the network at predefined intervals to determine whether the socket is still working correctly.
If this description applies to the function, update all instances to a single-word term
timeline.author: dmuelle
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,49 @@

+#ISMESSAGEFILE FALSE
+#NLS_ENCODING=UNICODE
+#NLS_MESSAGEFORMAT_NONE
+
+
+clientConfig=GRPC Client Properties
+clientConfig.desc=Configuration properties to be applied to gRPC targets that match the specified URI when they are constructed
+
+target=Remote target
+target.desc=The remote gRPC target URI, with wildcard support.
+
+headersToPropagate=HTTP header names to propagate
+headersToPropagate.desc=HTTP header names to propagate from an inbound request to an outbound call.
+
+clientInterceptors=GRPC client Interceptors
+clientInterceptors.desc=A list of fully qualified class names for gRPC client interceptor classes.
+
+authnToken=Authorization token
+authnToken.desc=The type of authorization token to propagate.  Currently this must be "jwt" or "oauth".
+
+enableKeepAlive=Keep alive

replies.bodyText: I agree, this should be one word.  I'll update.
replies.author: wtlucy

timeline.bodyText:
An id of an ssl reference found in server.xml. The ssl configuration that is specified by that reference is used.
Single space between these sentences.
timeline.author: dmuelle
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,49 @@
+###############################################################################
+# Copyright (c) 2020 IBM Corporation and others.
+# All rights reserved. This program and the accompanying materials
+# are made available under the terms of the Eclipse Public License v1.0
+# which accompanies this distribution, and is available at
+# http://www.eclipse.org/legal/epl-v10.html
+#
+# Contributors:
+#     IBM Corporation - initial API and implementation
+###############################################################################
+# -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
+#CMVCPATHNAME com.ibm.ws.grpc.client/resources/OSGI-INF/l10n/metatype.properties
+#ISMESSAGEFILE FALSE
+#NLS_ENCODING=UNICODE
+#NLS_MESSAGEFORMAT_NONE
+
+
+clientConfig=GRPC Client Properties
+clientConfig.desc=Configuration properties to be applied to gRPC targets that match the specified URI when they are constructed
+
+target=Remote target
+target.desc=The remote gRPC target URI, with wildcard support.
+
+headersToPropagate=HTTP header names to propagate
+headersToPropagate.desc=HTTP header names to propagate from an inbound request to an outbound call.
+
+clientInterceptors=GRPC client Interceptors
+clientInterceptors.desc=A list of fully qualified class names for gRPC client interceptor classes.
+
+authnToken=Authorization token
+authnToken.desc=The type of authorization token to propagate.  Currently this must be "jwt" or "oauth".
+
+enableKeepAlive=Keep alive
+enableKeepAlive.desc=Enable grpc keep alive.
+
+keepAliveTime=Keep alive interval
+keepAliveTime.desc=The time to wait for new messages before sending a new keep alive ping.
+
+keepAliveTimeout=Keep alive timeout
+keepAliveTimeout.desc=End the connection if a keepalive response is not received within this time.
+
+maxInboundMessageSize=Maximum message size
+maxInboundMessageSize.desc=The maximum inbound message size.
+ 
+sslConfig=The id of an ssl reference in server.xml
+sslConfig.desc=An id of an ssl reference found in server.xml.  That ssl configuration specified by that reference is used.

timeline.bodyText:
avoid future tense.
Any other variables that can  be specified and passed to the GrpcTarget intact.

+clientConfig=GRPC Client Properties
+clientConfig.desc=Configuration properties to be applied to gRPC targets that match the specified URI when they are constructed
+
+target=Remote target
+target.desc=The remote gRPC target URI, with wildcard support.
+
+headersToPropagate=HTTP header names to propagate
+headersToPropagate.desc=HTTP header names to propagate from an inbound request to an outbound call.
+
+clientInterceptors=GRPC client Interceptors
+clientInterceptors.desc=A list of fully qualified class names for gRPC client interceptor classes.
+
+authnToken=Authorization token
+authnToken.desc=The type of authorization token to propagate.  Currently this must be "jwt" or "oauth".
+
+enableKeepAlive=Keep alive
+enableKeepAlive.desc=Enable grpc keep alive.
+
+keepAliveTime=Keep alive interval
+keepAliveTime.desc=The time to wait for new messages before sending a new keep alive ping.
+
+keepAliveTimeout=Keep alive timeout
+keepAliveTimeout.desc=End the connection if a keepalive response is not received within this time.
+
+maxInboundMessageSize=Maximum message size
+maxInboundMessageSize.desc=The maximum inbound message size.
+ 
+sslConfig=The id of an ssl reference in server.xml
+sslConfig.desc=An id of an ssl reference found in server.xml.  That ssl configuration specified by that reference is used.
+ 
+other=Any other variables
+other.desc=Any other variables can also be specified and will be passed to the GrpcTarget intact.

timeline.bodyText:
